author: SciShow
description:
Sometimes, being an expert in one scientific field doesn’t translate to another. But then there’s Luis Alvarez, a particle physicist who helped expand our knowledge of the world by investigating everything from atomic bombs, to Egyptian pyramids, to what actually killed the dinosaurs. This video was inspired by Collisions: A Physicist’s Journey from Hiroshima to the Death of the Dinosaurs, a new book by Alec Nevala-Lee. If you’d like to check it out, head to https://bookshop.org/lists/scishow-recommended-reading. Made in partnership with The Alfred P. Sloan Foundation.

Sources
Collisions by Alec Nevala-Lee (2025); publisher: https://wwnorton.com/books/collisions
https://www.britannica.com/topic/Fat-Man
https://www.energy.gov/science/doe-explainsmuons
https://www.sciencenews.org/article/muon-subatomic-particle-volcano-pyramid-physics
https://home.miracosta.edu/kmeldahl/articles/blows.pdf
https://www.nature.com/articles/285198a0
https://newscenter.lbl.gov/2010/03/09/alvarez-theory-on-d
title: What Dinosaurs, Pyramids, and the Atomic Bomb Have in Common

author: SciShow
description:
